instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1932: What is A1932? A1932 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2018, 2019 with EMC 3184, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01521..
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.PP3V3_G3S: What is PP3V3_G3S? PP3V3_G3S is a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in a G3S standby state. .
definitions.PP3V_G3H: What is PP3V_G3H? This is a typo of PP3V3_G3H When you see PP3V_G3H, assume they meant to type PP3V3_G3H.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-1
threads.message:
Hi guys. 

I have this <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Mac and it's no power. I get 20v when and the amps go to 0.099 go back down to 0 ans stays like that. I noticed once it went to 0.300 and that was it. No short circuits or components found and no liquid damage, no burned parts and the laptop it's in perfect condition.

<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> -5v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3S</SIGNAL> - 3v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_G3S</SIGNAL> - 1.8v
<SIGNAL>PP3V_G3H</SIGNAL> - 3.3v

Any suggestions would be good :) I have couple of days to fix this one, then client goes abroad.

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-1
threads.message:
Any liquid sign on the audio board/flex?
Did you test the board alone on the desk?
Is the machine recognized in DFU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-1
threads.message: No signs of liquid anywhere, I checked under the microscope, but I will check again. Evey the board alone it's the same. Haven't tried DFU mode still, but I will try also

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-1
threads.message: It also doesn;t go into DFU mode

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-1
threads.message:
You can try wire method.
Be aware, this board doesn't have dedicated pads to force DFU.
You should solder the wire from pin1/<RESISTOR>R8010</RESISTOR> to any <SIGNAL>1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> point.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-1
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-1
threads.message: I did the Pads connection and went to step 4 installing, but it got stuck there halfway

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-1
threads.message:
What error do you get?

Just in case, make backup of SoC ROM, blank it and should go to DFU automatically.
